channel.title: Blogs on because there are just too many things to remember
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on because there are just too many things to remember

item.title: You Cant Take It With You
item.description: S3 is a loverly beast. Store anything for as long as you like at virtually 0 cost. There’s one thing I came across recently though that’s a real bind: object times are not transferrable. That’s right, if you write an object now and tomorrow you want to move that object somewhere else, the time on the object cannot be transferred elsewhere.

item.title: New blog posts ... tjoef tjaf
item.description: Yup, don’t have time to muck around. Need to be able to blog about things I learn so that I can use them later. I think tjoef-tjaf is an Afrikaans expression meaning roughly, quick-quick. Here on Wikipedia are other ‘real Souf-Afrikan’ words in common use - like ja-nee Assumptions Your blog Hugo metadata and all that junk lives in ~/somedir/myBlog/ If not, then you can use hugo to create a new site in ~/somedir as follows In what follows, all my myBlogs live in ~/WorkDocs/cloudfundis/myBlog on my PC, and my githubpages repo is in ~/WorkDocs/cloudfundis/cloud-fundis.

item.title: Visual Code Studio and Scala
item.description: This week I am setting up my new laptop - moving off Mac finally and back onto Linux - YAY. So one of the things I’m getting working is Visual Code Studio and Scala. Sounds easy doesn’t it? Step 2 Scalameta is the extension for Scala on vscode. Install it; but wait, that’s not all - there’s more. Of course you went for Step 1 which was “aaah, this is easy, just download the extension and you’re done.
